title: 2.0: Tweak CI config

title: CI: Only run the server benchmark to avoid SIGKILL
body:
Don't run service benchmark since the async_service_direct benchmark causes SIGKILL on CI. For example:
- https://github.com/actix/actix-web/runs/687294657
- https://github.com/actix/actix-web/runs/687170532
- https://github.com/actix/actix-web/runs/687421955

PS: I'm new to the project, please review carefully :-)

title: actix-web: Bump up to 3.0.0-alpha.2

title: actors: Bump up to 3.0.0-alpha.1

title: Remove content_length from ResponseBuilder
body:
Remove content_length from ResponseBuilder, since it'll be overwritten by the response body
FIXES #1439

title: correct spelling of ConnectError::Unresolved
body:
blocked on actix/actix-net#135

also corrects spelling of internal method in actix_http `Inner::check_availability`.

title: allow parent data containers to be accessed from child scopes
body:
`ServiceRequest::set_data_container` now adds to an array of `Rc<Extensions>`s and lookups reverse iterate to find the closest app data of that type.

Adds the `tinyvec` dependency to keep a small set of references to data containers on the stack, up to 4 data containers, which should cover most use cases optimally.

title: Fix audit issue logging by default peer address
body:
By default log format include remote address that is taken from headers.
This is very easy to replace making log untrusted.

Changing default log format value `%a` to peer address we are getting
this trusted data always. Also, remote address option is maintianed and
relegated to `%{r}a` value.

Related  kanidm/kanidm#191.

title: refactor h1 status line helper to remove unsafe usage
body:
Added benchmark of old vs new vs naive approaches. On average the new method loses about 20 nanoseconds but is quite a lot better than a naive method. Like with the content length refactor, you would not expect any noticable difference.

<details>
<summary>Violin plots from benchmarks:</summary>

![violin09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3316789/80850793-ad6c9e00-8c15-11ea-8a99-46dfd9f2e4f4.png)

![violin10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3316789/80850795-b0678e80-8c15-11ea-87d5-d55c4f27e93f.png)

![violin11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3316789/80850797-b3fb1580-8c15-11ea-8ef8-8aba67eca41d.png)

</details>

title: conditional test compilation [range, charset]
body: Also contains some small explanatory docs and removals of deprecated syntax.

title: clarify resource/scope app data overriding
body:
The current docs refer to "overriding" app data when using .app_data on Resource or Scope but it is not clear that this means overriding the entire parent app data container.

I would like to address this limitation but it seems tricky and will take some time to work out; I thought a docs update was called for, regardless.

Also centralizes the DataFactoryFn type alias and moves the tests for Extensions inside a conditional `mod test`.

title: simplify data factory future polling
body:
- improve code comprehensibility
- remove need for a manual Pin creation
- test fallible data factory

title: Fix typos in MIGRATION.md
body:
I noticed there's some small typos in MIGRATION.md.

Those are `crate` and not `create`.

body: fix https://github.com/actix/actix-web/issues/1466

title: Small ws codec fix
body: Minor fix.

title: fix spelling errors in doc comments
body:
Run over docs with a code spell checker.

Left in the relevant `.vscode` file with allow list but can remove if anyone has strong opinions.

Future fixes:
`ConnectError::Unresolverd` => `ConnectError::Unresolved` (breaking)

title: set data container on default service calls
body: closes #1450

title: Remove cache config from GHA workflows
body: We've hit some spurious failures related to caches recently (that failure is reported on actions/cache). It's quite experimental yet and I'd prefer to make CI _green_, so let's turn off it for now.

title: actix-http: Remove `failure` support

labels.name: B-semver-major
labels.description: breaking change requiring a major version bump

body:
The `failure` crate will be deprecated, see [current maintainer's post on IRLO](https://internals.rust-lang.org/t/failure-crate-maintenance/12087?u=johntitor) and [withoutboats' post](https://boats.gitlab.io/blog/post/failure-to-fehler/).
It's no rush but we should land this sooner or later.

Someone may want to support another ecosystem but I think it's out of scope here.

title: Deploy all the workspace crates' docs
body: Fixes #1340

title: Change NormalizePath to append trailing slash
body: For paths like /blah/ requests like /////blah now work. Previously this would 404 as the trailing slash was missing and NormalizePath only replaces multiples and doesn't add the trailing slash when missing.

title: Add explicit feature requirements for examples and tests
body:
This allow us to build 'actix-web' without default features and run all
tests.

title: Implement `std::error::Error` for our custom errors
body:
For allowing a more ergonomic use and better integration on the
ecosystem, this adds the `std::error::Error` `impl` for our custom
errors.

We intent to drop this hand made code once `derive_more` finishes the
addition of the Error derive support[1]. Until that is available, we
need to live with that.

1. https://github.com/JelteF/derive_more/issues/92

title: Upload coverage on PRs
body: codecov-action doesn't require tokens anymore so we can accept PRs from fork repos now.

title: 📝 Improve the code example for JsonConfig
body:
I initially submitted a new example in https://github.com/actix/examples/pull/268, and was recommended to add the example to the docstring in this repository.

This expands the JSON error handler to set a response code and return an error message in the body. It also 

I made a couple of changes compared to https://github.com/actix/examples/pull/268. I removed the 422 response, as I discovered that Serde sometimes gives an `is_data` type error even for malformed JSON. 422 is not supposed to be used if the request is syntactically incorrect. For example, `{"a": 5` will give an `is_data` error if `"a"` is expected to be a string, and not mention the missing closing curly bracket.

I could add the `curl` examples from the README in https://github.com/actix/examples/pull/268, but I'm not quite sure where they fit in best here. 

## Questions

- Should this example be in addition to, rather than replace, the current example?

title: Http2 client configuration to improve performance
body:
This PR should be fixing https://github.com/actix/actix-web/issues/1393. 

Since implementation is using hardcoded const need your opinion (pls see question below). Implementation is pretty much based on [hyper's resolving similar problem](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/blob/master/src/proto/h2/client.rs#L24-L28), though it sets initial buffer for quite large 5MB which gets some pressure off a task scheduler but requires more memory.

UPD: this PR also adding possibility to configure awc and Connector:
- initial_window_size
- initial_connection_window_size
- min_http_version

I have pointed awc_https example to this branch to show that it really helps:
https://github.com/dunnock/examples/tree/h2-speed-1393
Also it can be seen from benchmarks 
https://github.com/dunnock/awc_test/tree/benches

Speed with enabled alpn protocol:
```
	let mut builder = SslConnector::builder(SslMethod::tls()).unwrap();
	builder.set_alpn_protos(b"\x02h2\x08http/1.1").unwrap(); 
```
```
Benchmarking awc_test_openssl: 
Throughput 5994288B/s
Iters 10 total 101747060 elapsed 16974ms
awc_test_openssl        time:   [1.5834 s 1.6329 s 1.6794 s]                              
```
```
Benchmarking awc_test_default
Throughput 6327160B/s
Iters 10 total 101747060 elapsed 16081ms
awc_test_default        time:   [1.5967 s 1.7657 s 2.0360 s]                              
```
compared to reqwest
```
Benchmarking reqwest:
Throughput 6333067B/s
Iters 10 total 101747060 elapsed 16066ms
reqwest                 time:   [1.6207 s 1.7328 s 1.8409 s]                     
```

title: Demote lint level to warn
body: It's painful and can be checked even if it's not errors but warnings.

title: Add actix-http support for actix error messages
body:
As part of actix:0.10 release actix will not have "http" feature flag https://github.com/actix/actix/issues/321 which allowed to break circular dependency. Though actix does not support handling of actor's error messages via ResponseError anymore. 

This PR introduces "actors" feature flags which would re-add support for handling of MailboxError and ResolverError (with "resolver" flag).

title: Remove uses of Pin::new_unchecked in h1 Dispatcher
body:
This removes the last uses of unsafe `Pin` functions in actix-web.

This PR adds a `Pin<Box<_>>` wrapper to `DispatcherState::Upgrade`,
`State::ExpectCall`, and `State::ServiceCall`.

The previous uses of the futures `State::ExpectCall` and `State::ServiceCall`
were Undefined Behavior - a future was obtained from `self.expect.call`
or `self.service.call`, pinned on the stack, and then immediately
returned from `handle_request`. The only alternative to using `Box::pin`
would be to refactor `handle_request` to write the futures directly into
their final location, or avoid polling them before they are returned.

The previous use of `DispatcherState::Upgrade` doesn't seem to be
unsound. However, having data pinned inside an enum that we
`std::mem::replace` would require some careful `unsafe` code to ensure
that we never call `std::mem::replace` when the active variant contains
pinned data. By using `Box::pin`, we any possibility of future
refactoring accidentally introducing undefined behavior.

title: Update `time` to 0.2.7

title: Create helper function for HTTP Trace Method
body:
What
--
Add a helper method to create a route with `TRACE` method guard.

Why
--
Provide a helper function and have symmetry between the attribute macros from the `codegen` crate and the helper functions fro the `web` module. (_there's a trace macro already_)

Closes #1371

After https://github.com/actix/actix-web/pull/1332 there are incompatibility issues in actix-web logger left as well as some tests need to be reenabled.

This PR is resolving incompatibility issues so that whole workspace would compile and run tests with local actix-http version. PR is still placed against msg-body branch.

title: Replace unsafe content length helper

Attempting to replace unsafe blocks in the actix-http h1 helpers.rs file with safe equivalents that are as performant as possible (though I don't expect a small decrease in the performance of these functions to materially impact an overall request's performance).

title: Remove extra '#' so client docs render correctly.
Conversion of MessageBody to accept Pin in poll_next
body:
Starting conversion of `MessageBody` to accept `poll_next(self: Pin<&mut Self...)` as it was adviced in https://github.com/actix/actix-web/issues/1321#issuecomment-579339623 .

This is breaking change and probably should be included in the next version, amended versions accordingly. 

Following versions updated as part of this PR to align with semver:

 `actix-http` 1 -> 2.0.0-alpha

## Checklist:

- [X] Draft implementation of actix-http
- [X] Fix tests in actix-http
- [X] Benchmark & compare with non Pin version
- [X] Prereview 
- [X] Review

- Publish actix-http with version 2.0.0-alpha to crates
- Fix dependencies (actix-web and awc), update versions:
 `actix-web` 2.0 -> 2.1 (probably should go to 3.0?)
